Name: resorcinol production, hydroperoxidation of meta-diisopropylbenzene | acetone, liquid | EN15804GD, U
Category: C:Manufacturing/20:Manufacture of chemicals and chemical products/201:Manufacture of basic chemicals, fertilizers and nitrogen compounds, plastics/2011:Manufacture of basic chemicals
Description: Benzene is dialkylated with propene in the liquid phase by using an AlCl3 â€“ HCl catalyst (neglected in the inventory). The cleavage of m-diisopropylbenzene dihydroperoxide to resorcinol and acetone is carried out under acid catalysis (1 % H2SO4) with a reaction time of 30 min. After neutralization, acetone is distilled off at normal pressure and resorcinol under vacuum. The overall process yield is ca. 75 %, based on benzene.;Acetone is a valuable by-product.;C6H6 + 2 C3H6 --> C12H18;C12H18 +2 O2 --> C6H6O2 + 2 C3H6O;References:;Schmiedel K.W., Decker D. (2011): Resorcinol, Ullmann's Encyclopedia of Industrial Chemistry, Wiley-VCH.;Thebeeapelo J. K. (2002): The investigation of the hydrolysis reaction of m-phenylene diamine to resorcinol, Master Thesis, Port Elizabeth Technikon.
